definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: Comparisons in the looks department may be inevitable, though.
sentences.chinese: 不過外觀上的比較是在所難免的。

sentences.english: There will always be innocent casualites of war, but this was not the case.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭中的無辜傷亡在所難免，但是，這次情況不同。

sentences.english: If travel is unavoidable, the Shenzhen bus network on your side.
sentences.chinese: 如果出行在所難免，深圳巴士網在您身邊。

sentences.english: It is the inevitable consequence of the imbalance, and inequity, in the way public resources are distributed.
sentences.chinese: 失衡和公共資源的不公平分配是在所難免的。

sentences.english: Contradictions and differences are inevitable in the development course of bilateral relations.
sentences.chinese: 在雙邊關係發展中，出現一些矛盾和分歧在所難免。

sentences.english: Therefore, is unavoidable the internecine strife started.
sentences.chinese: 於是，一場在所難免的火拼開始了。

sentences.english: We know these issuses arose naturally in the process of our development.
sentences.chinese: 我們知道在發展過程中產生這些問題在所難免。

sentences.english: However several errors exist in the four present editions.
sentences.chinese: 但現在的四種版本訛誤在所難免。

sentences.english: In a work of this range and detail, omissions and misprints are inevitable.
sentences.chinese: 諸如此種廣博而精細的工作，闕漏與錯印在所難免。

sentences.english: Though this dictionary wasn't compiled in curtness, the mistake cannot be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 本詞典雖非草率之作，但錯誤仍在所難免。
